alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 7:23PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Intense snow showers will impact portions of southeastern Mineral, west central Missoula, south central Lake and southeastern Sanders Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 722 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking intense snow showers along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Alberton to near Frenchtown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alberton, Wye, Evaro, Frenchtown, Arlee, Ninemile, Huson and Stark. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 73 and 95. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
